question: Which European country has voted in favour of banning full facial coverings in public places?
explanation:
Switzerland voted in favour of banning full facial coverings including the niqab and burqa in almost all public places.
Around 51.21 per cent of voters voted in support of the proposal. France was the first country in Europe to ban facial coverings in public places in the year 2011 and the European Court of Human Rights upheld the ban in 2014.
